description.value:
Totem of Grandfather Thunder

Totem Spirit (Respect) — Creation Cost: 8 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Judgment / Authority / Storm

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • You gain advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks
  • When you make a Gnosis Roll, you may treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Grandfather Thunder's authority.

For 1 minute, while within 30 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members gain advantage on saving throws against fear, charm, and being frightened
  • Once during the duration, one pack member may reroll a failed saving throw and must use the new result

This represents Thunder's presence enforcing resolve and order.

Ban — Authority and Resolve

Grandfather Thunder demands respect for rightful authority and decisive action.

The pack must not defy, undermine, or openly contradict its chosen leader during moments of danger or crisis, when unity is reasonably possible.

If the pack fractures authority through open insubordination or refusal to act decisively, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease. To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Grandfather Thunder may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
